Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: AKK2050
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location of The Address for three nights and enjoyed the hotel very much. The food was great, rooms and facilities were excellent and fantastic staff to help make great memories for you. The signature scent is great and creates a nice and warm ambiance in all public and common places. I will recommend this property to all family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “One word: Stylish”
Reviews.Author: ARaaf
Reviews.Content: When you enter the lobby you are greeted by a beautiful arabic inspired fragrance which is released throughout the hotel. The first impression of exclusive perfume is the beginning of an equally pleasant overall experience - This hotel is very good indeed, staying here is warmly recommended. To me the only draw back was the location. It is a bit far away from the airport and the Dubai mall, but I guess it depends on what your objective's are. After a few nights I transferred to The Address Downtown, a bit more luxurious (a lot more expensive) but it was a better fit for me.

Reviews.Title: “Black and Camel colors”
Reviews.Author: 42_Countries
Reviews.Content: If you love hyper modern hotels then stop reading this right now or you will get annoyed. The Address is indeed hyper modern. Styled in the colors of black and camel (the only way to describe the color - beige is not good enough) it is marbled and stainless steeled to the hilt. It has obviously been designed - not in the sense of subtle - more "integrated" with the same color and material. Never relieved by reds or blues - it is relentless. You are greeted with the latest sit-a-desk-in-a-lounge-chair type registrations. It feels like a pleasant job interview, when all I want is my room. The room I was in was small but relieved by a balcony. Which is great. The view is over the Marina - actually as a Marina it is not what you think - it's a tiny waterway winding between 70 story buildings some of which are still being constructed. Fascinating if you like to study construction methods and the use of cranes. The Beige and Black room (relieved by the odd beige brown) is good if small. The bathroom is large - as that is when the camel/black marble comes into its own. Looks like square water taps are all the go now. Big shower and a bath with a big window to get a closer view of those cranes. Supermarket - yep there is a good one in the accompanying "Mall of Endless Brands" Staff - good but they are way too obsequious for this Australian Walking - forget it - you can walk around the "Marina" but the view is as I described. Food in hotel - so so - loads of promise, lots of bowls and 'stations' - but dull. they need some good advice on this. They go for the overcooked and the 'stews'. If you like potatoes in a stew and pasta this is the place for you. Internet - as expected - excellent and easy Other: you get more pillows and light switches than you need in a lifetime. Basically the whole Marina area should have an "Under Construction" sign and wait till it's finished before letting in people. As a suggestion they could plant a tree or create cascading gardens.

Reviews.Title: “A Stunning Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JD2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Address for 3 nights during the Dubai Desert Classic. We booked on line & within minutes the hotel called us to confirm the booking, arrival times & arrange airport pick up. They also called back the next day to find out which room preference and floor we would like. On arrival, we were collected by silver range rover and driven straight to the hotel which was stunning. It is very modern and very stylish. Our room was stunning, beautifully decorated with fantastic night views! We decided to go & eat - the only restaurant there is a buffet style place, it was VERY busy so staff were rushed off their feet! As a result, we were offered water upon being seated and then we couldn't get their attention again until we wanted the bill!! not ideal!! The food was nice, but not great. We also tried the pool bar for a lunch time snack, but it took 15mins to get any staff attention! The hotel is stunning and in a great location to walk to lots of places and to get to the golf, it is attached to a nice mall, but the lack of restaurants was a little disappointing. We ate in the mall each night. i would stay here again, it is a great place and the rooms are stunning-the bed is one of the most comfortable i have ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel without Arab kitsch”
Reviews.Author: rik2011
Reviews.Content: No golden camels, no 1001 nights kitsch, no belly dancing ... the Address is a no-nonsense 5 star hotel. Rooms are spacious and you don't need to be an IT manager to switch on the TV or to find the light switches. maybe a bit boring, but at least you don't get a headache from all the golden, Saudi style furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel... no personality...”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: The Address Dubai Marina like many hotels in Dubai is a fantastic modern hotel located in the Dubai Marina complex just down the road from all the famous hotels on the beach. My airport transfer was ok, but a tad on the expensive side, considering the good taxi service that exists from DXB. The staff is very efficient, and it seemed has if no-one was actually in the hotel as the lobby was always quiet, and the check-in area never crowded with a wait. Perhaps it was just the time of the year/week that I was there. One important tip: The hotel will allow a 24 hour room use for some room categories. You may find as I did that upgrading the the next category can be cheaper than paying for two nights. The additional fee is about 50% of the room rate. I'd stay here again if I had business in the immediate area, otherwise I will be checking out some of the other great Hotels in Dubai next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,huge rooms,fantastic pool and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: CHOPSKI
Reviews.Content: The drive from the airport in a huge Audi was a great start,we had one car for my wife and I and one for the kids (all included in the price of a Grand Room).From the moment we arrived,around 8.30 am we were made very welcome and our rooms were ready which is always a big plus. The pool is fantastic for a non beach hotel and the bar food isnt too toppy,soft drinks (coke/7-up) about £3.50.You get the sun all day,the noise of the traffic from SZR can be a pain but you soon wont notice it,especially if you get the beds furthest away from the beach hut. Rooms are really big ,we opted for 2 Grand Rooms,I think its worth paying extra for the free booze (6.00-11.00 pm) in the bar plus other little extras which you can find on their website. Breakfast was ok,not a bad choice and was never too busy. The hotel is also connected to a huge shopping mall which even has a Waitrose if you need any creature comforts. One thing we had a issue with,which someone mentioned on a previous review,was the noise on a Wednesday,Thursday and Friday from the nightclub on the 4th floor.We were on floor 7 and didnt get to sleep till 3.30 am due to the constant thumping of the music.I spoke to a hotel manager the next afternoon who couldnt do enough to help us and moved us upto 11th floor straight away. Upon arriving back in UK in my in-box was a e-mail from the hotel apologising for the room disruption etc. All in all I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would stay here again,just make sure your room isnt above the disco!

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: milena_dj
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel 3 times so far. As I travel a lot for business comfort is very important for me. I was always staying in the Grand Room that is facing the swimming pool. That view is amazing. Rooms are very spacious, bathroom is huge and has everything that you need. Bed is one of the most comfortable I ever slept in. Staff is good and helpful, breakfast is amazing and has numerous options. The hotel is connected to the small shopping mall which is very convenient if you need to buy something that you forgot at home without wasting time in traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Furious111
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, good location, overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “Great pool for swimming”
Reviews.Author: Espoo_FinlandMeri
Reviews.Content: The pool in Address is huge, almost 50 metres long. So if you like to do sports swimming, do go here! It is probably the largest pool in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Thoughtful Service in a Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adi-Bandi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on our way back from our honeymoon. As a regular traveller, was looking forward to experiencing the "Address" brand. From the moment we stepped in, the service was excellent. Lot's of thoughtful touches including a cake and decorations in our room congratulating us on our honeymoon. They were flexible enough to change some of our arrangements. For e.g. as we didn't utilise the hotel airport transfer (as it was anyway provided by Emirates) they provided us with private drop off in town. Rooms were good, practical and comfortable, though for a "Grand Room" it could have been bit bigger. The bathroom amenities were of good standard. The location suited us, bit quiet about 20 mins outside downtown Dubai, but adjacent to a small but excellent Mall. Lot's of good restaurants in the Mall itself and along the Marina. The only dissapointment was the breakfast. Variety of food items and quality were abit amiss compared to other 5* Hotel breakfast spreads.

Reviews.Title: “Quality without the Hype.”
Reviews.Author: IMSMITH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 26th Jan to 30th Jan and upgraded to a 'club' room. For a modest increase in room cost we had a suite and also free luxury transfers to and from the airport and free snacks and drinks in the downstairs bar and cafe which was excellent value for money. The infinity pool on the 4th floor roof was lovely and a relaxing place to while away a few hours. The Hotel itself is what you would expect of a classical 5 star Hotel but without the 'glitter and gold' chavie approach of some of the 'Palace Like' Hotels that abound here. As the Hotel is attached to the Mall and the walkways around the Marina then this is an excellent centre to stay as a base for exploring Dubai. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Luxury Hotel in Marina Area”
Reviews.Author: Vilmante777
Reviews.Content: Amazing Luxury Hotel and Apartments with Dubai Marina Mall underneath itself. Lots of activities. Lots of restaurants close by. Not far away from the sea and Main Boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. best hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Shatha77
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I have stayed few times and will always be my hote of choice in Dubai. the location is fantastic and adjacent to the mall. The rooms are spacious with view of the marina and pool. the Pool is huge, although i've never been but seen from my balcony. I can't tell you enough. the service is great, the staff are polite. it's great value for money and a really 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Boutique Hotel in the Marina Area of Dubai”
Reviews.Author: opbrand
Reviews.Content: The Address Marina is a luxury, warm and friendly hotel in the nice Marina area in Dubai. Beautiful, very large, rooms and conveniently located next a (not so massive as all the others) shopping centre and close to Jumeirah Beach Walk, the main boulevard of the Marina Area.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered luxury”
Reviews.Author: ronq8i
Reviews.Content: My mom came for a Dubai dream holiday and I wanted to treat her and show her the Dubai she has always dreamt of. The Address definitely did not disappoint. It is an "address" meant to impress and it truly does. I liked it so much that I went back for a second visit and it did not disappoint. So why would I recommend it? Where do I start. Location location location- situated on the Dubai marina and walking distance to JBR, and just off Sheikh Zayed Road it is ideal. It is easy to get around, close to the hustle and bustle, yet a feeling of secludedness that allowed you ample peace and quiet. The views from the balcony overlooking the pool and the Marina is truly spectacular. Having an elevator that is key controlled meant that you felt as safe as houses as no un-authorized persons could gain access to hotel floors. Ideal for females traveling without male companions. Hotel room- stylish yet comfortable and cozy. Sundowners on the balcony! Well worth it. The pool bar and restaurant- great venue to sit and listen to music(live saxophonist played in the evening) - super place to chillax and put your feet up after a day of shopping and checking out the sights. And the pool is amazing/stunning in fact. Staff- superb from the moment You check in until you leave. Unobtrusive and efficient. Breakfast is pricey but excellent and worth trying out. The only hitch throughout the whole experience- do not order a half bottle of red wine from room service. At 500 Dirrham for an ordinary red wine(ridiculously over-priced) you might as well order the bigger bottle at half the price(go figure). It's a five star hotel and it delivers everything it promises and more. Go and spoil yourself- I have no regrets and neither will you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice endeed!”
Reviews.Author: Peter_from_Finland
Reviews.Content: Visited The Address for a week in early January for a vacation combining golf, shopping and sun. The Address is perfectly situated considering the great golf establishments in the neighborhood. Only 5 min to Emirates and 10 to The Montgomerie with taxi (ride 20 Dirams / less than 5 euros). The service at the Address is top class; friendly, attentive and stil relaxed. We had a Grand room which gave us a lot of complimentary services and the room was just perfect. The mall in connection to the hotel was also a big plus. If anything, the view from the room, considering the price, was perhaps not what you might had expected as there is a constant building process going on on all sides of the hotel. We might had preferred to have the balcony towards the pool. The atmosphere at the hotel is also perhaps more like a business hotel than for a vacation, but that is perhaps just a matter of size - the hotel plus the residence hotel is enormous and now, when the hotel was pretty crowded (Russian winter holiday etc.), you could not obtain a free deck mattress at the pool in the afternoon unless waiting for an hour or so. The night club's noise was also to be overheard until early hours. Anyway, definitely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “Nervous westerner finds comfort”
Reviews.Author: mylestraveled
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, when I was told by my company that I was traveling to Dubai for a meeting, I was very nervous. I had never been to the Middle East and I had no idea what to expect. I was truly "ignorant" of the local culture, customs, traditions, etc. I did a little research, but that didn't quiet my anxiety. First things first, this hotel was PERFECT for me!! It was upscale, great service and connected to a mall...oh, and the beach was a short walk, too. The hotel and the mall were like a warm blanket for me because they made me feel comfortable and relaxed. To be honest, I was a big chicken, and not really into exploring the local area and culture. I know there were great adventures to be had if you're not a nervous nelly like me...boat rides, local markets, camel rides, desert jeep rides, etc. Food at the hotel was VERY diverse...something for everyone including italian, indian, and asian options at lunch and dinner. A few tips I learned from fellow westerners: everyone speaks English and wears "western" business attire so no need to be concerned with that, women should not initiate conversations with men as it appears forward (even saying hello or good morning in the elevator, who knew?), don't take picture of the men or women in national dress (especially the women), be careful exposing too much skin as a woman just be conservative with skirt lengths, etc. If I ever find a need to go back to Dubai, I will definitely stay at an Address Hotel again. They have one downtown near the big mall, too!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Nono_Minou
Reviews.Content: Once again, I was on the road and stayed at the Address in Dubai Marina. This was my second stay at this hotel and my 4th trip to Dubai. One of my colleagues booked me a room here as our office is almost opposite street (air distance but not by car...). After a great flight from London, the immigration area was quite crowded and even if travelling in business class it took me more than 1/2 hour to get thru. Luckily, the Address Hotel has its own little desk when you exit the customs area and I was greeted and swiftly brought to a huge 4X4 Ford monster and I was the only guest. Very smooth drive to the hotel (it was 1.30AM). The checking was quick and very pleasant. The receptionist knew that that I stayed before (last time was in February 2011). Got a suite (#915) again which was great on the 9th floor and on a corner. The bathroom is filled with Acqua di Parma products. The rest is just beyond expectations. You only get the best (hifi, TV, expresso machine, etc...). You will sleep more than well. The breakfast: perfect ! Not that is not fair. It was a 11 pts on a scale of 10. I had some fresh fruits and then dim sums. Sat outside on the terrace overlooking the boats and the canal of the Marina. Try to sit outside if not too hot. If your colleague(s) smokes then it is even better. The pool outside is great and there is a fitness center that I did not have the time to use. We used a lot the business which was very efficient and discrete. We had a few meetings in the coffee shop (not the right term) in the lobby. Very convenient. On my way back to the airport, had a splendid white Range Rover with chauffeur. Newspapers and water on the rear seat. Fast, safe and excellent drive ! Hope to stay here again next time. A 5 star hotel. Definitively !

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Morjen
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, the rooms are spacious and the beds extremely comfortable. It was also nice to have a balcony and free internet. It is in a great location, attached to Marina mall and a short walk from the metro. Downside was that the noise from the bar kept us awake most nights and it doesn't close until 3am! It is also very expensive in the hotel for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but excepted better...”
Reviews.Author: PJVM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 5 days on-route to Europe & was slightly disappointed. The hotel it's self beautiful & rooms amazing but some of the staff let this property down. The room, bed & bathroom amazing. Nice touches were the iPod docking station & the LeCube Nespresso. The room attendant each day spoiled me with extra capsules each day. The room attendants & the concierge workers are the best assets of this hotel. The hotel is connected to The Marina Mall which it large & getting around is easy with allot of cabs & the Sky Train near by. The biggest disappointment were the very rude staff in the Mazina Restaurant where breakfast was served each day & the check-out receptionist. The girl didn't say a single word to me when I was checkout. No "how was your stay" or anything. Just a typical Asian nod. Maybe I chose the wrong time of year to pass thru Dubai as it was Ramadan & things were very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent like all Address Hotels”
Reviews.Author: GPS001
Reviews.Content: This has been my first time at tThe Address in Marina Dubai (I had previously stayed at the same chain hotels, Downtown and Dubai Mall. Like the others, it is simply excellent. From valet service, to reception, room service, the laundry service, breakfast, lunch, the spa, the bar in the lobby, the swimming pool, the gym area.... they were all at the top. An excellent choice if you want to stay in Dubai but have to commute to Abu Dhabi, as it sits quite outside the trafficked strip of downtown Dubai. But it is good choice also to wander around Marina Dubai. The swimming pool is really nice (see photos), the gym is spacious and modern, the spa was excellent.... you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Neil R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in June 2011, and loved it. I travel extensively for business, and this was my second time in Dubai. The hotel is beautiful, with fantastic facilities for both business and holiday traveller. The staff were excellent and very attentative. I arrived very early in the morning at 2am, and they couldn't do enough for me. I would not hesitate to stay here again, I hope i get the opportunity. The location is excellent, and one can walk to the beach in around 10-15 mins. Also a short walk to the Dubai Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing rooms, service a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: scotsontourz
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel, with very spacious, clean, comfortable rooms. Bathroom was very large, with good shower and large bath. Reception staff were incredibly welcoming. Only small disappointment was breakfast which costs AED100 per person but service is very slow. Constantly have to seek out staff to get coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: medsBom
Reviews.Content: Good hotel . Attached to the Marina mall. Room was nice . I was a bit disappointed with the service for breakfast . It was a bit slow. Otherwise friendly staff. Worth a stay.the mall is small compared to thE Dubai mall.they have a bar which was crowded on fridayl night

Reviews.Title: “Solid but you may get better value for money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: svensktiger
Reviews.Content: Last time in town, we stayed at The Address Marina for ca 200 AED more. With that in mind, you get so much more value for those money spent. That included breakfast too. But booked out this time. Apartment alike hotel. Perfect temp in room and good temp provided good nights sleep. Oddly dimensioned bathroom. Talking washbasin and shower fit. Kitchen with Nespresso machine. Arrived early in the morning and they offered us a shower in gym area, which worked fine. Diligent support from all service staff. Did breakfast at a Starbucks in the Dubai Marina Mall, one block away. Learnt from others that breakfast wes shallow. Free wifi -- always appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, value for money?”
Reviews.Author: akhan11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on a business trip, was a pleasant stay with minor hiccups. The service is great, whether in the room or the dining facilities. The facilities provided are top notch with some maintenance issues cropping up (iron no working, flush was faulty, fuse burning out). Dining quality is good, variety could be better ( 5 days in the same hotel, same breakfast and lunch can do that to you) Only negative for me was the location as it is next to a sleepy mall and sleepy community. It could do with a bit of zing! Having said that, it is vey well connected with SH. Zayed road and the metro and JBR a walking distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel with that added personal touch”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeNick
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with exceptionally welcoming staff. Cold towels upon arrival and the check in is seamless. You are even shown to your room by the person checking you in. The whole place is spotless; rooms are large and a great swimming pool on the roof of the 4th floor. A shopping mall is right next door and the beach / JBR promenade a 5 minute walk. Our only regret was staying just the 1 night before returning home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frequent T
Reviews.Content: After several visits to Dubai, I decided this time to try the Address Dubai Marina and it was a good choice. The location is quite good; there is a shopping attached to the hotel. Only the Dubai Metro is a bit far away. The service was excellent. Fast and efficient check in and check out. All the staffs are extremely friendly and efficient. After my arrival I had a look at the hotel and especially the staff in the fitness centre gave me a very warm welcome. Thanks for Ali to show me around in the gym and explaining the facilities. The room was spacious with good quality amenities. The only disappointing place was the breakfast restaurant. The staff is not very friendly and attentive. I definitely would recommend this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff! Friendly and helping!”
Reviews.Author: Besanc0n
Reviews.Content: Great staff starting from Piyarat (from Thailand) at front desk during check-in, jump started my "The Address" experience from a high level. She was very kind and smiling. After the initial signatures and formalities of check-in she got up and shoed me to my room at the 7th floor, she even showed me inside my room about all the facilities, bar lights etc. I have never had such a welcoming experience where the front desk person, accompanied me till inside my room making sure I was comfortable and felt at home. And I have stayed at Marriots and Sheratons in Pakistan and Dbai, but never seen such a kind staff starting from front desk reception to bell-hop, bar waiter, concierge etc. Friendly and helping bell hop young guy "Bek" (from Uzbekistan) was nice to talk to and offered availability to help out whenever required while on duty. Roman at "Blends" is a gem of a guy to have at that place, was very kind and helping. Makes you feel comfortable and feel like you are relaxing in your lounge at home. Great atmosphere of blends. David at concierge desk was kind and helping. He remembered me and my name from just one meeting and this was useful as I once had to send a message to my driver waiting outside while I was dining in Mazina, I gave the message to the waiter, the waiter came back saying that I told David who knows you sir and has passed on the message to your specific driver. The early morning front desk staff was also kind and in good spirits so early in the morning around at 5:30am when I had trouble gettting up the guy kept on trying to wake me up with a "manned" snooze service.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: fred s
Reviews.Content: Arrived and hotel disputed my rate. This was despite having written confirmation from them. Basically I had a rate that included breaKfast. Logged on to the website showed this rate and still they did not honour it. At the end even the travel agent couldn't convince them. Given the high quality hotels in Dubai i'd avoid this one as they don't honour their rates. Nice hotel but rubbish service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AbuDhabiDoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as Mexican Independance Day was being celebrated in one of the ball rooms. What a great hotel! The rooms were exceptional, very classy! We were upgraded so we also had a small sitting area. I loved the bathroom and the shower with all the jets. Beautiful view of the marina and the pool below. Enjoyed a delicious buffet breaksfast as well. Looking forward to returning. The only negative was the smoke detector was directly above the bed and the light on it was a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Service lacking.”
Reviews.Author: ascemom
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to my first visit here. The time it took to get our bags from the bell desk was about 30 minutes even though the hotel was not busy and we had told them we needed them ASAP. Ordered ice and a knife from room service. Another 30 minutes a small bucket of ice appears along with a fork. Asked housekeeping for extra towels, there were 2 of us in the room and only 2 towels were provided, it took another 30 minutes to get extra shampoo and towels. Very dissatisfied with the service. Lastly asked for a late checkout and front desk jokingly said 30 minutes. The spa on the otherhand is fabulous, great service, clean, excellent staff. Will only come back to the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel - Not really for Vacation”
Reviews.Author: homer3152
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a 5 star service and equipment. Staff was superb in every way, everything you queried was immediately taken care of. Very nice room in a moddern dark-braun/white style. Excellent gym, very good breakfast. 10-15 min walking distance to metro. Very nice, but small adjacent mall - not the real thing if you look for a Dubai mall. Huge swimming pool to give you a good work out after work. HOWEVER: not my recommendation for vacation, simply because of the location. From pool you dont look at the sea but towards the rather ugly architecture of The Walk and its yellowish sky scrapers - so, for vacation, i would definitely prefer a beach-side hotel like the Hilton or the Meridien. So, as a business hotel: 5 stars; for vacation:4 only.

Reviews.Title: “Addicted to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nada-Enan
Reviews.Content: I had a one-month-long project in Dubai before I permenantly moved there and was lucky to stay at this hotel. I absolutely loved everything about it. The service level there exceeds anyone's expectations and they are so details oriented! The international breakfast buffet had a lot of varaities. I also was addicted to its pool side bar; both during day and night had nice vibes and delicious drinks. The room is very luxarious and spacious. I had a marina view, which over looks the beautiful Dubai Marina. which was a plus. The spa was by far the best spa i have ever been to. Its super relaxing, elegant, and the treatments were great. (I had a facial and a massage both were just perfect). What is a plus is that the hotel is also connected to a very nice mall, Dubai Marina mall. I would def. recommend it to all Dubai business and leisure travellers, and would stay there again if i could!

Reviews.Title: “comfy”
Reviews.Author: AHMED_A_A
Reviews.Content: the room were nice good to have a nessprsso and premium dilmah tea in the room the only negative point will be is regarding a design failure in the toilet, when the toilet seat cover is open it will keep pressing on the water button and the water will be running all night

Reviews.Title: “Great service, luxury rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: Stroke_FurryWall
Reviews.Content: We spent time at this hotel on our first trip to Dubai. The service was amazing - every staff member was always keen to help or ask you if you needed anything. The rooms are very clean and have a 'modern' touch to them. The breakfast buffet is fantastic with fresh food and several options for everyone. The fresh waffles we had here are so far the best we have had so far in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “the same excellent service”
Reviews.Author: summerinabudhabi
Reviews.Content: Coming back for a short stay to Dubai, I decided to book again The Address Dubai Marina. I found the same excellent service .The same warm welcome upon arrival and the nice staff of the reception who recognise me as a repeated guest Even it was Ramadan, I couldn't see any difference on the level of service and I want to congratulate the staff for this

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the room service”
Reviews.Author: DameDuFerAustralie
Reviews.Content: I booked The Address at Dubai Marina for a 2 nite stayover before jumping on another long-haul flight for work - have stayed at The Address Dubai Mall and loved it, so thought I'd try another member of the group - I landed very early in the morning however had booked the room for the previous evening so I would have no issues checking in early etc - the hotel lobby is very impressive, and a very friendly Egyptian guy booked me in. I was given a lovely refreshing cool facecloth and mint tea during the check-in process, which was a very nice touch. The check-in guy actually upgraded me to a huge one bedroom suite for no additional cost - I think he took pity on the fact that I'd paid for the previous night but not actually slept there, very kind of him and quite unexpected!! I hadn't asked for an upgrade, so thanks very much again!! The suite was lovely, with a huge bathroom and separate bath room, the bath was actually a lovely deep spa which was much appreciated after a long flight! The shower was a bit oddly placed but didn't overly bother me. Nice quality shampoo/conditioner etc. My sole complaint was the quality of the room service - it was seriously average! I ordered an Arabic entree which was extremely underwhelming, and my main course was the same. I had the buffet breakfast the next morning downstairs in the hotel restaurant and it was lovely, loads to chose from and very friendly staff. Shame the room service food was not of the same quality!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: welcometoedu
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great facilities and rooms, nice staff, and good location: near the beach and well connected to the city center. Awesome breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Blbovka
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. My room was huge and very well supplied - had desk and dressing gown and mini bar and kettle amoung other things. Lovely big walk in shower as well as a bath set in the window so you can sit in the bath and look at the view! A very big and beautiful pool, with stunning views down by over the marina. The breakfast selection was very big with choices from around the world so everyone should be happy. Tried the A La Carte menu at the Arabic restuarant in the hotel in the evening and it was also very good. You can pre-arrange a transfer from the airport and they have a booth at the airport to get the car from. The cars were as smart as the hotel! The only thing is I am not sure exactly what is round about the hotel. There isn't anything obvious within walking distance so any site-seeing/trips would need to be by taxi - although that is probably very typical in Dubai anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite and detailed outlook”
Reviews.Author: DubaiFiaz
Reviews.Content: Firstly it's relevant to note there are some hotels you stay, check in, check out, the Address is not one of them. So whether your on a budget with a little money to spend or after luxury and prepared to pay the cost, the hotel ethos brings a new welcome most cannot deliver effortlessly. I stayed at this hotel for a month, it became almost like my home. From the large lobby, to the greeting and setup from the initial interest to the hotel, to the local amenities store In the lobby, this hotel like Armani, creates a splendid environment for your stay. I had breakfast buffet at the main restaurant, to directly being linked to the mall, my 1 bedroom suite is practical to stay in. Surely the owners have purchased and lease, maintenance costs be weary as my door didn't work initially, s limit on general amenities, to some mix ups, overall you will have negligence sometimes but the overall assistance was propelled by: Thanks to Omar Hammad Ali for assistance on meeting rooms, Rocio for setup on my initial stay and of course I would call my friend Angelo Enas for making my stay as easy as possible. I'll be thinking about perhaps visiting this hotel for a stay in the future for business. Fiaz.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Ganga72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Address for a 1.5 week business trip, and I would recommend this hotel to others. Pros: *The staff is all very friendly, and I felt they would bend over backwards to make sure your needs are taken care of. *The hotel is connected to a mall, which has a souvenir shop, grocery store and a variety of fast food restaurants (KFC, Cinnabon, Starbucks). *My hotel room had a beautiful view of the marina and pool. *The shower's water pressure is very strong, just the way I like it. *The breakfast buffet is extensive and I never came away hungry. Cons: *The rooms don't seem to have many free outlets, which was an issue when I needed to charge my laptop, Blackberry and camera battery at the same time (next time I travel, I'll remember my surge protector). Plus, there wasn't an outlet in the bathroom other than one for men's razors, so I had to use the outlet by the desk to dry my hair in the morning. *In order to use the printers in the Business Lounge, staff had to go to another room to pick up the papers for you, then tally up (by hand) the charges. I would have preferred a quicker method, but the staff was nonetheless very accommodating when I needed to print out 100+ papers before my business meeting early one morning. *My room also overlooked the hotel's lounge/club, and I could feel the beats of the techno music playing Thursday and Friday night. In all, this is a beautiful, modern hotel, and the staff is top-notch. I was a single female traveler, and I always felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and sophisticated, an oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: GRT7V
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the lobby, I was struck by an oasis of calm yet professionalism amongst the staff. Check in was efficient and I was guided to my suite effortlessly going through the services I could expect from The Address Marina Hotel. My accommodation was spotles, spacious and very comfortable and very 'now'. The iPod docking station is a plus and even more so the free WiFi which for business travellers is a must. The huge infinity pool is best visited in the morning so you can face the sun and not the concrete. Most city hotels in Dubai suffer from a view of office and apartment blocks by the pool but when the Marina is finalised, I am sure there will be more interesting things to look at! The hotel is adjacent to the Marina MalLauD though not huge by any standards, the outlets and coffee shops are quite sufficient and there is a cinema too. Blends bar is a really cool place to meet but the dining options are limited. However, if you are staying just a few days it's ok as the food and service are exemplary and anyway, the centre of Dubai (and the airport) is a mere 20 mins drive.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel great experience”
Reviews.Author: Donjjjordan
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel couldn't fault it, there is some building work going on on the harbour front but all in all stunning views also there is a great mall attached to the hotel catering for all shopping needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: alasorous
Reviews.Content: The address is primarily a business hotel but without any stuffiness. Overall there is such a feeling of calm from the moment you walk in the lobby and stays throughout. The spa is fantastic, general quality of rooms etc is top. I always stay here as it's close to jumheira walk, near friends and now with the Marina mall joined to the hotel easy to pick up a few things after dinner. However the best part is the price - this was actually cheaper than the Hilton (horrid) - only slightly for the room (140$ish) but then drinks, Internet etc were all cheaper too - to have such luxury so affordably is why it's 5 stars all the way for me.

Reviews.Title: “First Class - Perfect Business Hotel with a wonderful Gym”
Reviews.Author: kissthesunsetpig
Reviews.Content: Located in the Dubai Marina, this hotel is attached to the Marina Mall, offering a range of facilities which make the location doubly convenient. A Starbucks 30 seconds walk from reception without going outside - perfect! The rooms are excellent, with powerful (although slightly loud) air conditioning (didnt bother me). There is free WIFI everywhere (Kempinski take note, everywhere means everywhere!!), bathrooms are big and the beds are wonderful. The breakfast buffet is first rate - they even have Marmite. A final word for the gym, easily in the top 3 hotel gyms i ever saw (and i have seen a few). Nice outdoor inifinity pool with a small terrace which becomes one of Dubai's trendiest night spots in the evening. All in all, if you want a great business hotel, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & Top Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sarnia96
Reviews.Content: Elegant, modern designs with natural colors and materials. Loved the large main entrance, very modern yet quintessentially Dubai flavored! Rooms are well furnished with excellent maintenance. The view of marina is splendid, although the marina feels a bit claustrophobic due to densely crowded high-rises around it. I stayed at a Grand room that has 270 degree view - Sheikh Zayed road, marina mall and the swimming pool. Splendid!! The staff at front desk and the "Service plus" team are impeccably mannered, and very welcoming. The swimming pool is quite large, with a "kind of" infinity view - which is interesting. Food is exquisite - go to Mazina. In short, excellent hotel. Wish I took my family with me on this trip. Will certainly return to stay here another time!!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent weekent”
Reviews.Author: vk2000
Reviews.Content: It is one of those good 5 star hotel with good location, attached to mall for your family shoping, sneek out to movie if you get tired of activities. Service very courtious and prompt. Food - I will recomment if they can include more options in vegetarian segment. There is a lot of room for improvement in dinning varieties. Gym is excellent. I will recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: svensktiger
Reviews.Content: 2 things really augmented my stay: the Nespresso machine + iPod speaker! Overall this is a very good hotel for both business and leisure travelers. It's not as per my definition a 5* as I experienced some service flaws. In my view a very solid 4*. Big, spacey rooms with wonderful view over the Marina. So make sure you get a room facing the Marina, the view from the shower area is so cool too. Can be a bit noisy during late nights as MJ plays out loud! Tiptop breakfast including Asian choice as well. Like the gym a lot too, with helpful and nice PT:s. Pool area is super. The Shades/pool restaurant is quite pricey though. Free Wifi but quality a bit wobbly. Really like the helpful concierge guys (Kenneth & CO)! Adjacent to the Marina Mall, not so big though but appreciate they have a Starbucks. It's probably a 5-10 mins walk from hotel down to the beach boardwalk. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “not bad hotel but not worth your money”
Reviews.Author: obatwa
Reviews.Content: I stay on the hotel for 5nts as part of my anniversary honey mooner programms , I checked in and out by MR. AMIR( it is our bad luck) really you feel this guy like a dead person you do not feel any life in his face . I request for upgrade he refuse, so I requested him to call the duty manger which in turn he refuse as well and he said I do not find any reason for upgrade!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! please give me a breack ,my marriage and my honey mooner r not good reason for the upgrade . although I told the manager ASSIM I have been upgrded in the privous hotel,but he refuse and he promise me to make special arrangements to give my stay a touch of romance which was a cake (please give a break again) Any how the hotel expensive and not worth the money you pay ,you can find better deals with more luxury chain hotels like hilton , ritz carlton ....... Definitely I will not stay at this hotel again and I will not recommend it to other AND DO NOT CHECK IN OR OUT WITH AMIR

Reviews.Title: “Great place to have to work!”
Reviews.Author: kings0
Reviews.Content: Arrived as part of a major company conference. what a great city and even better hotel. staff were first class, conf facilities and meetings etc could not be better. hotel rooms are large and well appointed. food great gym and pool to die for. will be back, hopefully on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money for 5 starers”
Reviews.Author: Mamraj_Chahar
Reviews.Content: Though I mostly spent nights, it was enjoyable. The room was very spacious with all ultra-modern facilities. I had complimentary break fast of my choice which again was very good. The hotel runs a complimentary (rather complementary) luxry bus quite frequently to Dubai Mall and enroute destinations. Swimming pool is good but without complimentary snacks/fruit salad.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: zkhan4
Reviews.Content: I was a little sceptical about staying here after reading all the other reviews that others had left. However, the was little choice considering it was haldf term and all other 5 star hotels were either fully booked or overpriced. I was not dissapointed at all. I think the hotel was overall very very good. The service and personell were fantastice and very accomodating. The food was great adn the swimming pool was wonderful. The concierge in particular managed to get us a table at the Burj al-Arab with only 2 nights notice - which was a pleasent surprise. The hotel room was very clean. Overall the hotel exceeded my expectations and i would happily return here for business or pleasure. My partner will agree with me also.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!”
Reviews.Author: ankitasingh86
Reviews.Content: The ambience is classy, the staff is really good.It is classy, elegant and it is absoulutely the best!! Best hotel for a business conference. The view is beautiful. Overall it was a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: ValMech
Reviews.Content: I arrived for a business trip and I had a good welcome by the front office agent. nice smiley lady. check in process was fabulous and fast. i was upgraded to a suite which was very nice and large. food at the hotel is average, they could use some help there. service was friendly and the staff was nice. i don't mind going back, especially if i will get again my upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “excelant stay in dubai”
Reviews.Author: oltea
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel for business purpose;very nice hotel, with friendly staff , especially in the front office, very helpful.The rooms are very comfortable, with free internet , coffee machine ( I loved it !NEspresso!).Nice view from the room I had, overlooking the pool and the Marina.The access to the mall is done through the hotel lobby, is great!If you go to Dubai for business or leisure , you really have to consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Bertie33
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to stay in quite a number of UAE hotels over the past years, but this relative newcomer tops my list. The trendy surroundings and overall quality make this is an outstanding venue. You are made to feel special from the moment you arrive -- private check-in, none of the counter business here, thank you very much'! What to say about the room? Well, of course, it's huge, with all mod cons (huge plasma, i-Pod docking station, wetroom,....), but the USP was no doubt the sweeping view of the Marina, with a picture window next to the bath, which made bathing a whole new experience! All facilities are equally faultless; from the infinity pool to the spa and the restaurants. The Address adds a new twist to things: though the main restaurant is organized as a buffet, the large number of cooking stations, combined with the food being displayed elegantly in small portions, means one is never overwhelmed; The quality of the food (the deserts are to die for!) was matched by the impeccable personalized service of the staff. Of course, this kind of pampering comes with a substantial price tag, but then you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ozallan
Reviews.Content: We thought we were booked into The Address at Dubai Mall but somehow was booked in here. It is a really smart hotel with big rooms and comfortably furnished. I had a room overlooking the marina and the views were great. Recommend that you request a marina view room. I found the service to be good and prompt. The breakfast buffet is one of the best of I encountered with a huge choice of western and eastern food. I love a soft bed but even for me their beds are a bit too soft and the duvet is a bit too heavy particularly for the Dubai climate. Why don't hotels have blankets anymore? The disadvantage is the location as it is a fair way away from downtown. It is nearly a 1km walk in either direction to the nearest metro station and then about 10 stops to down town. Or it is about a 30 minute cab ride. There is a great shopping mall attached to the hotel with a good selection of shops and eating establishments. A British supermarket called Waitrose which specializes in organic produce is also in the Mall.

Reviews.Title: “A Holiday with Mummies”
Reviews.Author: muhen
Reviews.Content: First step inside the hotel on the way to the reception where staff are just talking loud in arabic which i understand because I'm saudi. Look like they pretending they didn't see us passing by we still need to say excuse and that's the time only they greet us. I thought I booked in Egypt only pyramid missing. Not so good for first impression and it's our first time in the hotel. We had some issues about the service and ask for manager but no body call us. We came down to ask but very busy. The hotel itself is amazing except for the service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Crissy85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Address Marina 5 nights during last November. The first impression was really superlative. At the moment of check-in (1.30am) all the staff was helpfully with us. After a offered complimentary cold tea ath the desk, the receptionist drives us to the room and explained us all the facilities. Great the breakfast, with an incredible amount of choises. All the staff was polite and kindly. Good position, near the new centre of Marina. The room was stylish and the cleaning service was always on time to put new towels and bathrobe. I would suggest the member of Tripadvisor to book at Address Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukanduit
Reviews.Content: The Address at Dubai Marina was a lovely hotel - very stylish and 'new' with excellent facilities. The pool area was excellent as was the hotel bar on the 4th and the gym was very good. The rooms were great, very spacious with fab beds and a superb shower. Only downsides would be the service - you had to ask for things to be done that you would expect just to happen (this did include getting our room serviced on one of the days!) - though all the staff were very willing to fix things and so hopefully these are just teething problems.

Reviews.Title: “do not go there!!”
Reviews.Author: brausimausi
Reviews.Content: As much as I liked the Address at Dubai Mall ,as much was I dissapointed in the Address at Marina. The aircon was böowing directly into my face when in bed. There is something very wrong with the rooms because everyone in our group had a problem with uninterupted sleep. (duvets too heavy, matress too soft, noises from the bar ) When I ordered roomservice I asked the waiter for change so I could give him a tip , he returns with 2x 50 Dirham ( which are 10 Euros each) believing me for a fool , who would not be able to know the conversition rate. Service at the hotel was rude from the valet parking to concierge. After 3 days I moved to the Grosvenor House ,where I paid less for a 1 bedroom app. with breakfast and service was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “One Address I would avoid is this one!”
Reviews.Author: George123R
Reviews.Content: We stopped - had to carry our own luggage to the reception area. Even when we entered the hotel, none of the staff bothered to help my wife who was carrying our baby and a suitcase while I struggled with the other luggage. At reception we were told that we will have to pay extra for the additional bed which we requested for our son.When we made the booking we were told hat the extra bed will be complimentary. I don't mind paying but please don't offer it first for free and then charge me! When we got to our room it was stinking of the smoke. Back at reception the rude lady told me that she was aware that we requested a non-smoking room but she only had a smoking room available. She thought we would accept it. I was then told to wait another two hours before our non-smoking room will be available. Despite them telling you, yu can check in at 4pm. We checked in after 4pm and now the room will only be available at 6pm. I told her that we will leave as we had another appointment but I want the extra bed & our luggage in the room when we return later that evening. Guess what? On our return at 10pm our lggage was not in the room nor the extra bed. The lady at reception was unfriendly, not really interested in her work. She just kept on apologizing whith her plastic smile. Sorry THE ADDRESS, thanks to this lady we will not returning to your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Address is an excellent hotel in a...”
Reviews.Author: Bizzy_TravellerUk
Reviews.Content: The Address is an excellent hotel in a city of excellent hotels. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the staff are welcoming, helpful, friendly and pleasant without that Dubai trait of being intrusively attentive. They've got the balance exactly right. They remember your name and in such a busy hotel, that's pretty good! I accidentally left some items in my room post-checking out and they could not do enough to make me feel comfortable that all was safe and secure - and get things back to me. The only downside perhaps was the restaurants, which were a bit ordinary and uninspiring. That said, its a stones through from about a billion other restaurants, so not a big deal. If you go to Dubai, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and pool”
Reviews.Author: Oldsurfer
Reviews.Content: I goto Dubai quite a few times a year, it was the first time i stayed at The Address although i have always stayed in the Dubai Marina area. The hotel is right next to the new Dubai Marina Mall - has most things you need but is no where near as large as the Dubai or Emirates mall. The cinema within the mall is due to open later in July 2010. The hotel is very new and quite grand. I was lucky enough to get upgraded to a Premier Suite room - this was great it was very, very large with seperate large bedroom with a large lounge area, balcony and a good sized bathroom. The hotel has a great swimming pool - very large infinity pool. The sun bathing area is well equiped with nice beds and sun loungers but in the winter months I would imagine that it will get very crowded as the area is quite small. The buffet restaurant is OK, average food but a good choice. The Rive Gauche French restaurant was great, really good food BUT afterwards i had an upset stomach....... The service from the front desk when checking in was superb and generally there was good service. BUT compared to the Grosvenor House Hotel the hotel does not meet their very high service levels and excellent staff or the food options or the great attention to detail. However, the rooms at the Address are more modern and larger. I would go back but the GHH does win by a big way. I give GHH 9/10 The Address is a 7.5/10 - but the score may have been lower if i did not get the upgraded room

Reviews.Title: “Nice to relax”
Reviews.Author: BI-Consultant
Reviews.Content: For a Weekend trip I decided to go to Dubai. After checking the Internet, I decided to stay at the Address Dubai Marina. Even if the Hotel isn't Downtown, it's a very cool place to stay. The breakfast is awesome as well as the Rooms. With the right amount of money you also can get a Room on a very high Floor Level, so you can enjoy the view even if you taking a bath. Also the service does not let any wishes open and you can get what you want at any time. The beach is only 10 minutes away by foot if you getting tired using the pool at the 4th floor. So should it be the case, that you are looking for a place to rest and don’t worry about the money (250$ per Day) the Address is a great place to relax and enjoy life at the same time, regarding to the Hotel quote “The Address where life happens” PS. Of course does every rooms also enables internet surfing for free with a good speed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View, great bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Abdhabigurl
Reviews.Content: I will begin my review by saying my family is Muslim. Ok Rooms were very clean, and sleek. We really enjoyed the expresso-maker. The balcony provided us with enjoyable late-night meals overlooking the beautiful marina, and the bathroom was superb. Our room was overlooking the pool, and there were women in thongs in full view of overlookers. Our room was also well-stocked with alcohol which we had removed in advance. If you want the full cultural experience I wouldnt suggest this hotel, or this area as most of the guests, and their manners are fully Western. If you dont mind it you will enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: littlelebanon
Reviews.Content: it was an OK hotel.it was the most expensive i stayed in in Dubai but not the best. there are much nicer hotels in dubai with much less cost

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel in trendy location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller07_10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Address Dubai Marina for a business meeting and have to say it was great. Very friendly and welcoming service. Great facilities the gym overlooking the marina is a must! I was surprised about the great breakfast selection. The meeting space is spacious with lots of daylight! After our meeting we went up to the outside bar around the giant infinity pool. Great DJ music and just relaxing atmosphere even though is was quite warm already. Later on we went for dinner to their french Restaurant and this was by far the best food and service I ever received in Dubai. I will definitely come back. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel being brand new has fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: dokomo
Reviews.Content: The hotel being brand new has fantastic new rooms equipped with an iPod docking station and free internet access. The staff was extremely friendly, from check-in to concierge assistance the service was impeccable. What was impressive was the pillow menu with over 12 different types of pillows catering to special neck and back requirements. The rooms facing the marina have a fantastic view! The hotel is conveniently located close to the jumeirah stretch which have a lot of good retaurants and bars however it's quite far from the Dubai mall. Overall the hotel was fantastic and an excellent choice for tourists looking for a five star hotel with an extremely well furnished room, lovely balcony with a stunning marina view and a very comfortable bed!

Reviews.Title: “disaster”
Reviews.Author: althaah
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my wife and experienced the worst ever hotel. They couldn't bring us to the room because the receptionist said it is not ready. I can see the hotel is very busy because there are only a couple of staff working reason for the other guest to be waiting in line. There is not even any amenity given for the delay. I wait for long time and gave me room with construction view. We couldn't sleep because of the people shoutin in the bar they have. The next day I went down to request for late check out and found egyptian receptionist chatting. I told my dissappointment but the guy did not care and told me I will be charge 50%. I request to speak to the manager and they try to call him but manager cannot be found. This hotel have everything. have a very bad view, very noisy, very rude staff. a very bad service. The owner wasting money for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CHIC, CONVENIENT AND WITH STYLE.”
Reviews.Author: jwylam
Reviews.Content: LOVED IT. staffs were all friendly and motivated, service was fast. I arrived at 7 am and obviously my room was not ready yet, the receptionist without having me requesting gave me a room so that i could rest and get dressed and start my day and change my rooms after check in hour s with no charge. Locaiton was not bad . close to the JBR walk. taxis are in line waiting for us, theres a shopping mall connected to the hotel with a food court and nice shops to hang out. Nice pool, nice room with decent size balcony of the pool. Most of all theres NESPRESSO coffee machine in the room with the capsules, for a coffe lover , its the most important in the morning! & an ipod speaker!! Free internet!! Buffet in hotel was nice. we went on a seafood night. and it was only 200AED per person! well worth it!! very nice experience . would definately choose The Address next time i go!

Reviews.Title: “An hour to check in???? We were the next in line!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Treasureglore
Reviews.Content: Wow, we are so disappointed in lack of customer service at this hotel. Let's just say that there is no customer service! Will not stay here again, not worth it!

HotelInfo.Name: The Address Dubai Marina
HotelInfo.Address: Dubai Marina, Dubai 32923, United Arab Emirates
